                                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException

        A driver name that can be used in the getConnection() function.

      • getConnectString

        public static java.lang.String getConnectString(java.lang.String dbms,
                                java.lang.String ip,
                                java.lang.String port,
                                java.lang.String database,
                                java.lang.String user,
                                java.lang.String pass)
        Parameters:
        dbms - The name of a DBMS (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server)
        ip - The IP address of the DBMS.
        port - The port the DBMS is on (optional, can be "" to use default).
        database - The name of a database to connect to (can be "" for MySQL)
        user - The username to use when connecting.
        pass - The password associated with the username.
        Returns:
        A connect string that can be used in the getConnection() function.

      • staticCleanup

        public static void staticCleanup()
        Call this when shutting down your application to deregister SQL drivers.

      • testConnection

        public static void testConnection(java.sql.Connection conn)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        This function will test a connection by running a simple test query. We cannot rely on Connection.isValid(timeout) because it does not work in some drivers. Running a test query is a reliable way to find out if the connection is valid.
        Parameters:
        conn - A SQL Connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if the test query fails.

      • connectionIsValid

        public static boolean connectionIsValid(java.sql.Connection conn)
        This function tests if a given Connection is valid, and closes the connection if it is not.
        Parameters:
        conn - A Connection object which may or may not be valid.
        Returns:
        A value of true if the given Connection is still connected.

      • caseSensitiveCompare

        public static java.lang.String caseSensitiveCompare(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                    java.lang.String expr1,
                                    java.lang.String expr2)
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This will build a case sensitive compare expression out of two sql query expressions.
        Parameters:
        conn - An SQL Connection.
        expr1 - The first SQL expression to be used in the comparison.
        expr2 - The second SQL expression to be used in the comparison.
        Returns:
        A SQL expression comparing the two expressions using case-sensitive string comparison.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • stringCast

        public static java.lang.String stringCast(java.sql.Connection conn,
                          java.lang.String queryExpression)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This will wrap a query expression in a string cast. If the database is not supported by this function, the queryExpression will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        conn - An SQL Connection.
        queryExpression - An expression to be used in a SQL Query.
        Returns:
        The query expression wrapped in a string cast.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • quoteSchemaTable

        public static java.lang.String quoteSchemaTable(java.lang.String dbms,
                                java.lang.String schema,
                                java.lang.String table)
        Returns quoted schema & table to use in SQL queries for the given DBMS.
        Parameters:
        dbms - The name of a DBMS (MySQL, PostgreSQL, ...)
        schema - The schema the table resides in.
        table - The table.
        Returns:
        The schema & table name surrounded in quotes, usable in queries for the specified DBMS.

      • getResultFromQuery

        public static <TYPE> SQLResult getResultFromQuery(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                  java.lang.String query,
                                  TYPE[] params,
                                  boolean convertToStrings)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Example usage: getResultFromQuery(conn, "SELECT a, b FROM mytable WHERE c = ? and d = ?", new Object[]&#124; "my-c-value", 0xDDDD &#125;, false)
        Parameters:
        connection - An SQL Connection
        query - An SQL Query with '?' place holders for parameters
        params - Parameters for the SQL query for all '?' place holders, or null if there are no parameters.
        Returns:
        A SQLResult object containing the result of the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getRecordsFromResultSet

        public static <VALUE_TYPE> java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,VALUE_TYPE>> getRecordsFromResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                                                                              java.lang.Class<VALUE_TYPE> valueType)
                                                                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:
        rs - The ResultSet returned from a SQL query.
        valueType - The Class used for casting values in the ResultSet.
        Returns:
        A list of field-value pairs containing the record data.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the query fails.

      • getRecordsFromQuery

        public static <VALUE_TYPE> java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,VALUE_TYPE>> getRecordsFromQuery(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectColumns,
                                                                                          java.lang.String fromSchema,
                                                                                          java.lang.String fromTable,
                                                                                          SQLUtils.WhereClause<VALUE_TYPE> where,
                                                                                          java.lang.String orderBy,
                                                                                          java.lang.Class<VALUE_TYPE> valueType)
                                                                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:
        conn - An existing SQL Connection
        selectColumns - The list of column names, or null for all columns
        fromSchema - The schema containing the table to perform the SELECT statement on.
        fromTable - The table to perform the SELECT statement on.
        where - Used to construct the WHERE clause
        orderBy - The field to order by, or null for no specific order.
        valueType - Either String.class or Object.class to denote the VALUE_TYPE class.
        Returns:
        The resulting rows returned by the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the query fails.

      • getResultFromQuery

        public static <V> SQLResult getResultFromQuery(java.sql.Connection conn,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectColumns,
                               java.lang.String fromSchema,
                               java.lang.String fromTable,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,V> whereParams,
                               java.util.Set<java.lang.String> caseSensitiveFields)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:
        conn - An existing SQL Connection
        selectColumns - The list of columns in the SELECT statement, or null for all columns.
        fromSchema - The schema containing the table to perform the SELECT statement on.
        fromTable - The table to perform the SELECT statement on.
        whereParams - A map of column names to String values used to construct a WHERE clause.
        Returns:
        The resulting rows returned by the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the query fails.

      • createSchema

        public static void createSchema(java.sql.Connection conn,
                java.lang.String schema)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a schema in a non-SQLite database. For SQLite, this does nothing.
        Parameters:
        conn - An existing SQL Connection
        schema - The value to be used as the Schema name
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the query fails.

      • createTable

        public static void createTable(java.sql.Connection conn,
               java.lang.String schemaName,
               java.lang.String tableName,
               java.util.List<java.lang.String> columnNames,
               java.util.List<java.lang.String> columnTypes,
               java.util.List<java.lang.String> primaryKeyColumns)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:
        conn - An existing SQL Connection
        schemaName - A schema name accessible through the given connection
        tableName - The value to be used as the table name
        columnNames - The values to be used as the column names
        columnTypes - The SQL types to use when creating the table
        primaryKeyColumns - The list of columns to be used for primary keys
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the query fails.

                 java.lang.String schemaName,
                 java.lang.String tableName,
                 SQLUtils.WhereClause<V> where)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This function will delete from a table the rows that have a specified set of column values.
        Parameters:
        conn - An existing SQL Connection
        schemaName - A schema name accessible through the given connection
        tableName - A table name existing in the given schema
        where - The conditions to be used in the WHERE clause of the query
        Returns:
        The number of rows that were deleted.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the query fails.

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If either getSchemas() or getTables() fails.

      • convertWildcards

        public static java.lang.String convertWildcards(java.lang.String searchString)
        Converts a search string which uses basic '?' and '*' wildcards into an equivalent SQL search string.
        Parameters:
        searchString - A search string which uses basic '?' and '*' wildcards
        Returns:
        The equivalent SQL search string using a backslash (\) as an escape character.
        See Also:
        getLikeEscapeClause(Connection)

      • getLikeEscapeClause

        public static java.lang.String getLikeEscapeClause(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Returns an ESCAPE clause for use with a LIKE comparison.
        Parameters:
        conn - The SQL Connection where the ESCAPE clause will be used.
        Returns:
        The ESCAPE clause specifying a backslash (\) as the escape character.
        See Also:
        convertWildcards(String)
